text: Binky pulled the van into the parking lot of the most room down hotel you've ever seen. The last resort, I said, reading the neon sign that was missing the earth, the last resort said, Binky, that's what we call it, come on. Parked and into the lobby. Binky tossed the keys to the clerks' area about that. Yet not cool, said the clerk. Binky slept 100 on the counter. The clerk nodded okay fine. We three flowed through into the hall and up some stairs. The place was wrecked.

Cracked walls, stained and wet carpet, graffiti on every surface, but saw somehow open as a working hotel. Room 15-13? I said as we followed Binky in. Yeah, like you a book right? So weird, said Binky. Into the room we were met with a small wrinkly move tent and immediately and we went. The interior opened up to an impossibly massive space, clearly altogether in other place. Welcome to the haven, said Binky.

We work here sometimes when prepping for shows. The rest of them up collectively start their work, smile and stroll over for hugs. Thank you so much for coming, said Lucille, we could really use your help. Of course, said my friend anything we can do. First things first, said Keystone's own. Yes, said the triplets, first things first. All the of operations said Chaplin.
OK, I said sure. Here I see they said holding up the crack white cube. Here I see. It fell. It cracked. Smoked. And now there's a faint noise. Do you hear it? My friend and I listen intently.

I hear it said my friend and I did too. It was the tiny sound of a mass on a spinning wheel or a thin stream of water in a pipe. I faint far off train whistle. Of course we can't use broken works. And we can't fix it. The artist will not be happy they said. They need to keep working here, but use and we can go take care of this shit said Binky. Okay, we said in unison my friend and I, let's go said Binky.

Okay, we said again. Like, now said Binky. Yes, okay, we said again. A different limo appeared as the mob apparently called their floating into galactic surfboards. This one was all tiled in chrome like a mirror ball and off we went.

Through all the portals and tunnels and slides and ways and means and avenues and trenches and out above and below this way in that, all the sorts of connecting cosmic arteries that were recently become familiar with during our three days with the Valentine mob.
